alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 04 at 4:47PM PST until February 05 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM THIS EVENING TO 10 PM PST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 15 inches. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes highways 62, 138, 140, and 230 and the Crater Lake area. * WHEN...From 8 PM this evening to 10 PM PST Sunday. * IMPACTS...High country travel could be difficult. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. Visibility could drop to below a quarter mile in blowing snow briefly at times. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
